title: oppenheim architecture layers village-scale blocks and vibrant towers on albania’s coast

title: Tongtai School / E PLUS/SZA DESIGN
description: Tongtai School is located in Ningjin County, Hebei Province.It was funded and built by a socially responsible local enterprise, and contains educational facilities from kindergarten and primary school to  high school.The total floor area of the school  is about 60,000 square meters. Tong Tai School has a total of 72 classes.The phased construction and reasonable layout of shared supporting facilities are the key points of the overall campus planning.
author: 韩爽 - HAN Shuang

title: House da Vila / Mariana Orsi Arquitetura + Design
description: Seeking to preserve the original elements of the residence, this retrofit allowed for a perfect dialogue between the contemporary proposal and the existing roots, both of the house and the village itself. We preserved the original structures and proposed demolitions for greater integration and brightness of the spaces.
author: Susanna Moreira

title: The YMK Residence Brings Layered Living to the Karuizawa Highlands
description: Takeshi Hirobe Architects designs the YMK house in Karuizawa, Japan across six levels that follow its dramatically sloped, rural highland site.
author: Caroline Williamson

title: A Maui Home Blends Modern Minimalism With Climate-Conscious Design
description: A compact home in Maui by Hawaii Off Grid blends modern minimalism with climate-conscious design, featuring a sculptural roof and timber construction.
author: Caroline Williamson

title: This Sculptural Home Turns Minimalism Into a Statement
description: Brighton Sands is a four-storey family home in Melbourne designed by mckimm, blending inspiration from the LA hills with a distinctly Australian sense of place. Defined by sculptural architecture, natural materials, and a seamless connection to the outdoors, the residence offers a tranquil retreat grounded in light, texture, and flow. It’s a considered balance of form and function, where luxury is quiet, and every detail enhances daily life.
author: Erin

title: Modern Living Meets Montreal’s History in a Striking Loft Transformation
description: In the heart of Montreal’s Plateau Mont-Royal, La Firme has redefined what it means to live within history. Their latest project, Elmire, transforms a 19th-century industrial building into a refined contemporary home. Formerly a textile mill and Campbell’s soup factory, the structure now celebrates modern life while honoring its industrial roots.
author: Erin

title: Designed to Vanish: How Residential Architecture Is Evolving With the Landscape
